Words¶

Implementation of Word.

class words.Word[source]¶

Class that fetches all data for a given search_term.

Main function is search() function.

add_translations(self)[source]¶

Add translations to attributes [“examples”, “explanations”, “synonyms”, “antonyms”], if necessary.

audio_url(self)[source]¶

Getter function for _audio_url.

base_path(self)[source]¶

Return f"{self.data_dir}/{self.folder()}/{self.folder()}". Used as base to save files.

folder(self)[source]¶

Return result from search_term_utf8() with spaces replaced by underscores.

classmethod from_json(cls, path)[source]¶

Initialize Word from dictionary saved as .json.

get_fix_card_dict(self)[source]¶

Return the part of the data for the anki-card, that does not depend on the user-choice.

mark_examples(self)[source]¶

Highlights the search_word in the example sentences using css.

request_data(self)[source]¶

Get result from parsers in parsers and pass results to update_from_dict().

request_img_urls(self, keywords=None)[source]¶

Use parsers.Parser at parsers [“google_image_parser”] to get image urls.

Parameters

keywords – String for image search. (Default value = None) If not set, defaults to search_term.

Returns

List of img_urls.

save_as_json(self, path=None)[source]¶

Save class attributes as dictionary in a .json-file.

Parameters

path – If None, is set to f”words/{self.folder()}/{self.folder()}.json” (Default value = None)

search(self, new_search_term)[source]¶

Load data for new_search_term.

If possible loads from previously saved search. If not, uses the parsers to obtain info and adds translations, then saves the result for future searches.

Parameters

new_search_term –

search_term_utf8(self)[source]¶

Return search_term in lower case and with special characters replaced.

translate(self, string)[source]¶

Translate string from from_lang to to_lang.

update_from_dict(self, attr_dict)[source]¶

Update Word s attributes by iterating through attr_dict.

If the value is a list, it extends the original list, else the value is set to the value of attr_dict

Parameters

attr_dict – Each key should be the name of an attribute of Word, the value corresponds to the updated value.
